comment: Amazing professor. Fun class. He holds your hand through the labs. He helps after class if you are struggling. Enjoys what he does. I loved working on some of the projects. I even did the extra credit because it was interesting.

Professor Shaw does a decent job with lectures, but his assignments aren't the most helpful for learning despite being the majority of the work you do for the class. They are instructions on where to copy-paste his code, so you don't really learn it for yourself. Other than that he is a nice dude and is very willing to help those who struggle.

Not a bad professor. But he is very strict when it comes to grading. I feel as if he could have given some more points on some of my assignments. For example I was missing a texture on one of my assignments and got a 37/50 just for that little error its a 74?! Idk its a good course but I just feel like I had little help as regarding questions sent
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Quizzes are open note and he provides everything you need in his slides. Assignments are straightforward and he posts helper videos for most of the assignments. You will pass if you put in some effort. Don't let anyone cheat though, he gets worse at grading on time and grading fairly if someone is cheating :/
Prof. Shaw is a great teacher, but he is very strict and is a tough grader. Be sure to follow all instructions carefully, and follow his guidance videos when you need to.

Honestly one of the best online classes I've ever taken at KSU. He posts quality lecture vids every week instead of just posting the powerpoints like 99% of the other profs at this school. Gives you most of the code for assignments along with helper videos, you just have to piece the code together yourself and debug. Would take again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Shaw is awesome, his online lectures on computer graphics are great and he does a good job explaining things. The lectures can be a little long but you'll get a lot out of them. Homework is explained in a lot of detail in a series of videos every week, and it's mostly about making changes to existing HTML/JS code. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Easy to clear this exam with few assignments which are provided with step by step instructions to complete and simple project on SQL

Online quizzes and assignments every week. 1 midterm 1 final. This professor is a very nice and helpful guy. I was really impressed with how much information he put into his online class. One of the better online courses I have taken. Very willing to help and email you back.

Shaw made this class a little too easy. He posted about 85% of the code online (through tutorials) and left little to figure out. The pace of the class (very fast; summer) kind of justified it in some ways, though I wish he would have encouraged more critical thinking. He's also not that great of a lecturer and didn't come to class very prepared.

This class was an easy A, but to be honest the prof was not very involved besides his "helper videos". The video lectures for the class are from another professor for the undergraduate version of this class. Also, he takes forever to grade homeworks and post final grades at the end of the class. Answers to the test questions can be found online.
Professor Shaw is a good teacher. Just put in the effort and you will be fine, he is always willing to help his students.
Professor Shaw is a good teacher. I have had for many classes and I enjoy going to his classes. Just put in the effort and you will be fine, he is always willing to help his students.
He really knows what he's talking about and will help you with anything you need to be successful in that class. You do labs in class which in turn help you do the homework.

How much you know about programming does not matter  when you take his classes. Forget about code reuse, readability, and efficiency. Your grade will largely depend on how well can you copy what he is typing in the labs. If you are slow at copying things down like me you will most like do bad. This is not is not the best way to learn.

I have had two class with him and here is what I have to say. If you try you will be fine, if you don't try you won't be fine. Also unlike most professors I have had if you ask a question he will do his best to answer it.

CompuSci is tough to start so tests & assignments will be hard, but if your output is correct he doesn't care which method you solve with. Late work for half credit. He often stayed late to explain problems to a few of us. He is often late for class & slow to grade, but he will leave important comments on your work. Kind and always in a good mood.

Professor Shaw is great. If you can handle showing up, and waiting 30 minutes for class to start past the scheduled time, he's worth it. He always helps when you have questions about the work, or have technical issues. When my grade was an 89 at the end of the year, he opened up another assignment for me to do to make an A. Good professor.

This class is so very hard.  His tests are mimpossible and nothing like he teaches.  Since it is a hybrid class you have to teach yourself most everything.  I barely pulled a C with prior programming knowledge.  Take someone else.

H.O.R.R.I.B.L.E at presenting material or even just teaching the stuff in a timely manner. He was an awesome man and a pretty good professor (in that he knew his material well), but he struggled bad with presentation. He just stumbles upon his words way more than I have patience for. Regardless, I would recommend to any beginner programmer.
Honestly this class was simple. Show up, pay attention, and you will be fine. He is often hard to find in person but he is very easy to email. Show up though because attendance is part of the grade.

I made a mistake taking his hybrid course, if you take his hybrid course you better get ready to teach yourself everything about computer programing. He shouldn't offer hybrid class, it so hard. I wish i took him for non-hybrid.

This class was a "hybrid" course, so it was half-online, half offline. The content was always very confusing because we basically had two teachers. Shaw gets very flustered when speaking. He also totally changed the format of the tests halfway through the semester. He expects you to have more of a prior knowledge of cs than we should for an intro.
If you take the hybrid class, You pretty much have to teach yourself the material. He's a cool teacher, but if you want to take a class to learn, sign up for a different teacher.
Best CS professor in Kennesaw. So helpful and cares that his students succeed and understand..may be a little unclear but just ask questions! hes nice!

Guy reminds me of astrophysicistNGT. Always in good mood. His lectures were very informative and leaves the room open for questions/comments and is very attentive to his students unlike a majority of the professors in the KSU CS dept. I wish I could take more classes with Mr. Shaw than continue throwing away money to be force fed outdated jargon!

Great class! His tests are straight from the slides, no textbook reading required. He also allows a double-sided cheat sheet on each test. A few online quizzes - not difficult at all. He's very enthusiastic about database systems and he is always ready to answer any questions you may have.

Dr Shaw is hands down the BEST teacher for CS 2301 and 2302. If your new to programming and dont really know where to start hes the guy to go to. Went to HARVARD AND MIT and really knows the material well so he makes it easy to understand. ALL EXAMS ARE OPEN NOTE AND OPEN COMPUTER. Helps you with every lab and hw and does it with u in class easy A.

took him for java I. Could not have been easier. his tests were open book and on the computer. you can freaking google durring a test. the labs were easy to me (possibly not for everyone). But if you needed help he would come check on you, he was nice enough to check on me even though i never asked for help. The class seemed ridiculously easy.

If you want to actually LEARN the material, don't take this guy. First, he was consistently late for class, then took a half hour of class time preparing for the class.  This consisted of a very disorganized 'lecture' where he would basically read a PowerPoint, then we would have a lab where we 'learned' to copy and paste the code.

Extremely easy. Take him for CS 3610 because other professors are much harder. Plus the class seems kind of pointless. He's really disorganized (he comes to class 15 minutes late every day). Don't bother buying the book -- tests come from the slides and he lets you bring s cheat sheet for every test and quiz.

Disorganized to a disgraceful level. He lost my first test and almost forced me retake it the next day (until he found where he'd misplaced it at his house.) Gives LOTS of pointless busy work. Doesn't actually *teach* any material, just clicks through other professors' powerpoints full of vague half-concepts. Allows cheatsheets though.

Professor Shaw is extremely enthusiastic, loves what he does. Wants to help you understand, and makes the class easy to pass with many basic assignments he does with the class. Very brilliant guy, provides study guides and allows open-book/note quizzes & exams. Understands most people in the class may not be CS majors. Would recommend to anyone.
What a great professor. Really tries to help you succeed. Great guy in general. WENT TO HARVARD AND MIT!!!!!! knows what hes talking about and makes it super easy on you.

A great teacher and a really fun guy! If you're interested in the material he'll make you understand it easily, and if not he'll spend time after class helping you until you get it. Half the class is lecture and the other half is a lab that he'll help you with if needed. Prof. Shaw is really passionate about what he does and is happy to help you!

This man is Harvard and MIT educated, yet he simplifies the material so we can understand it. Although the content gets harder towards the end, he will help you along the way. Tests are open-book, but you have to study if you want to do well. Finals are worth alot but overall, he is a great professor.

Loved Dr. Shaw!Everything is online but he is super helpful if you send him an email or ask questions in class. The hardest project was building a website. Keep up with the quizzes online, do the projects and show up for class (not mandatory but points for attendance) and you will get an A. Great class.
Great teacher, easy class. All the quizzes are online and you can take them three times. Tests are easy and you make a website that is easy too.

BEST CLASS EVER! BEST TEACHER EVER! He is amazing. If you fail this class, drop out of K-State please!!! Your making the university look bad lol. He puts all the quizzes online and gives you 3 times to take it meaning you just have to get an A on them. He is nice and knows everything about the subject. Easy to approach. I learned so much! Take him!

Very easy professor. Material is strait forward and tests and quizzes come directly from the PowerPoint lectures. If you cant get an "A" in this course, you may want to reconsider your college education...
Very helpful class.

Dr. Shaw is a great professor and a really good guy all around. His lectures can be kinda confusing and long winded, but is very willing to help outside of class. You can tell he is a very smart man and knows a ton about his field.
Dr. Shaw is an excellent instructor. He is very approachable and he goes above and beyond to help his students out. If you do the work in his class you just can't go wrong with Dr. Shaw.

He is extremely helpful and nice. His lectures are boring and confusing, he has a hard time to communicate in person but he is crystal clear in his e-mails, very prompt and detailed. Labs are interesting, tests are easy (open book final), plenty of extra credit - he REALLY wants you to succeed.I got A. Do labs, read a textbook & you'll be fine!

im not a cs major. this teacher gives you every opportunity to get a good grade. if you do not do well in his class it is your fault. he is enthusiastic, clear, and knows the material. he makes himself constantly available. highly recommended!
Taught as well as could be expected. The labs were interesting and rather easy. Seems a bit nervous at times and could stand to work on his delivery but aside from that he's just fine.

I loved Professor Shaw. He was helpful, nice, and the labs we had to do were easy and fun. He really almost handed you the code for the projects. He was a little nervous, but otherwise he was a good teacher and I enjoyed the class.
Horrible teacher.  That is all... HORRIBLE! and corny and annoying to add to it.
